title: Monthly consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in India July 2019
summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for All India and Month. In both cases, the Consumer price index have increased.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, All India had the maximum Consumer price index and it saw the lowest in Month January out of all 6 Months.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents Consumer price index on the Y-axis. And, how the value changed throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for All India and Month. In both cases, the Consumer price index have increased.
mid_summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
All through the Months, similar trend was observed for All India and Month. In both cases, the Consumer price index have increased.
Out of all 3 groups, Rural had the highest Consumer price index in Month June and Urban had the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
In Month June, All India had the maximum Consumer price index and it saw the lowest in Month January out of all 6 Months.
max_summary: This is a grouped bar chart showing Consumer price index on the Y-axis throughout 6 Months for All India, Urban, and Rural on the X-axis.
Over the 6 Months, the Consumer price index for both All India and Month have increased.
Month June had the maximum Consumer price index among all 3 groups, and it was for Rural. The minimum Consumer price index was observed in Month January for Urban.
In Month June, All India had the highest Consumer price index among all 6 Months and it has the lowest Consumer price index in Month January.
The maximum Consumer price index for All India that was found in Month June was 1.02 times larger than the minimum Consumer price index observed in Month January.
Among all 3 groups, Urban had the gap of 41.0 between the maximum and minimum Consumer price index observed in Month June and January respectively.

In Month June, Rural had the highest Consumer price index 1436.0 among the 3 groups and in January, Urban had the lowest Consumer price index 1380.0. The second highest Consumer price index 1429.0 was observed for Rural in Month June.
Averaging all 3 groups All India, Urban, and Rural, the Month June is the maximum Consumer price index and January is the minimum Consumer price index.
